title: Global IDs
description: Group of ids that represent where a gene is expressed, along with an order to combine for display eventually.

cellularComponentTermId.description: the id that represents a part, or the entire, expression statement - an ontology id.

biologicalProcessQualifierTermId.description: Only valid in combination with a value in the Cellular Component column. The cellular component qualifier column is derived from column 16 of a GO annotation when groups port GO CC annotations using GO extensions over to expression annotations.  There is an implicit
relationship between columns C and D.

nonCellAnatomicalStructureTermId.description: This is an anatomical structure, not a cell type.  The anatomical structure identified here contains the cell optionally identified in the cellularComponentTermId.

nonCellAnatomicalStructureQualifierTermI.description: cellularComponentTermId, nonCellAnatomicalSubStructureTermId, and spatialTermId are mutually exclusive.  spatialTermId is only valid when used in conjunction with the nonCellAnatomicalStructureTermId.

nonCellAnatomicalSubStructureTermId.description: This anatomical substructure is a part of the nonCellAnatomicalStructureTermId.  It can only exist if nonCellAnatomicalStructureTermId is populated.

nonCellAnatomicalSubStructureQualifierTe.description: cellularComponentTermId, nonCellAnatomicalSubStructureTermId, and spatialTermId are mutually exclusive.  spatialTermId is only valid when used in conjunction with the nonCellAnatomicalStructureTermId.
